reviewText: "Tae Bo Ultimate Abs/Butt" is a great targeted workout for Tae Bo enthusiasts who have already mastered many of the moves.  If you're new to Tae Bo, this isn't the workout for you - Billy switches from one exercise to the next fairly quickly, giving you little time to recover in between segments.  Nor does he explain the correct form for many of the moves (most of which you should be familiar with if you've worked your way through another TB video or two).  The two 55-minute workouts on this DVD also test your endurance, so if you're out of shape, a newbie to TB, or have a hard time with the Basic workouts, you should hold off on "Tae Bo Ultimate Abs/Butt."That said, those who have been doing Tae Bo for some time will enjoy these "new" workouts, even though there isn't any new footage to speak of.  Rather, Billy and his crew have gathered 55 minutes of the best abdominal and gluteal exercises from previous videos and edited them together into two separate workouts.  Each consists of a roughly 5 minute warmup, followed by 30+ minutes of kicking and/or punching, 15-20 minutes of floor exercises, and a quick 3-5 minute cool down.Each workout does a great job of targeting and working the desired areas.  I especially like the variety of floor exercises in the Ultimate Abs workout - rather than doing a zillion crunches, Billy mixes it up a bit and introduces a number of new exercises.  Unfortunately, the floor portion of the Ultimate Butt workout just repeats the same two exercises over and over - be prepared to do plenty of to-the-side leg lifts and roundhouse kicks, with a couple of other drills sprinkled in here and there!However, "Tae Bo Ultimate Abs/Butt" isn't quite perfect.  Like many Tae Bo workouts, some of the exercises are repeated more on one side than the other, and some are only done on one side, period!  This is really unforgivable - since the tape was edited together, Billy and his production assistants could (SHOULD) have hunted around for the best examples of each exercise.  For each uneven set, I could easily think of another video on which the set was performed with equal repetitions on each side.  Also, the editing is a little choppy - before one segment is over (i.e., before you've reached the last 8-count), the class is already starting on the next exercises.  This makes it quite difficult to maintain the correct form and do the entire set.  Of course, after doing the workout a few times, you learn to anticipate these difficulties and compensate for them.  Yet, it's still a major gripe - they had the opportunity to fix many of the problems present in their live/complete workouts and still they dropped the ball.  C'mon, guys, listen to your loyal followers already!
summary: Good targeted workout for Tae Bo buffs
Title: N/A

reviewText: The DVD has a special place in my heart because it was my first Taebo DVD. If we're going by how effective it is, this is a five star workout no problem. So what docked off a star or a half star? On a handful of the moves he only works one side of the body. Oh, Billy. I understand this DVD is a collection and clips from other DVDs, but you must work out both sides. Sure I pause it and work out the other side, but that's just a tiny bit annoying. The workouts are just shy of an hour. Why not work both sides and have it be an hour?Now for the good. The butt workout is my favorite of the two on this DVD. You feel the burn and there's some nice cardio in there, too. Just be careful when doing some of the floor work. Billy is kind of an animal and all about the "work it", which is good, but you want to make sure you don't work yourself into pulling something. I stretch and warm up before this workout. He does a warm-up, but I always feel I need more since his are short. I've never injured myself while doing this video.I did pull something with his original one and that was after serious stretching and a tried and true Jillian Michaels workout beforehand, so I know it was the original Taebo advanced that hurt me. It was just a pulled knee something for a day and a half and then I was fine, but I haven't done that workout since. I know some people rave about that one. Everyone is different. I'm in great shape and have been for years, so I think he was just going too fast. Plus he was kicking his legs in a fling it out there way, which you're not supposed to do and because it was going so fast I must not have been controlling the kicks like I normally do. It was his very first workout video years ago, so we've got to give him a break, because in his later DVDs he mentions about how you need to control the kick and not just fling your leg out there like a meat-head. Good man! :)Anyway, this DVD isn't like that. I've never pulled anything. It's also fun to see the old clothes from the nineties or turn of the millennium.The Abs workout is good, but I like the butt one a lot better. With the abs workout you get some cardio and obviously abdominal work. My only complaint is that Billy is in love with upper abs and obliques. There's hardly any lower ab work. So while this is a nice cardio and supplemental abs workout, for me personally I prefer to do other videos or ab moves to work that body part since I need more of a challenge.Overall you get two great workouts. I'm not sure if all these DVDS come with this, but mine came with two bitty bonus workouts that were five minutes each. That is a freakin' warm-up, but it's a nice sample of the upper and lower body workouts he also has available. Plus if I have the extra time, I just do the upper body five minute bitty after I'm done with the almost hour long ab workout. On a day I do the almost hour long butt workout, I just do the five minute bitty lower body workout afterward.This was my first Taebo DVD and what got me hooked on it. Bill Blanks is super motivating and encouraging.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This video is definitely intense in terms of working the abs and glute area.  Every time I do this video, I am sore for several days.  It's an advanced workout and one that you should do after doing Taebo for awhile.  It's also something someone should watch through before doing because it's clips of his Live videos so unless you're 100% familiar with everything Billy does, it can be a little hard to follow.  I recommend this if you're looking for a great abs/glute workout.
Title: N/A
